meanings.definition: To grant or convey (property) by feoffment.
meanings.sent1: He decided to feoff his land to his son.
meanings.sent2: The king feoffed the estate to the loyal knight.
meanings.sent3: The farmer feoffed his chickens to the fox as a prank.
meanings.sent4: She feoffed her heart to him, trusting him completely.
meanings.sent5: The magician feoffed his powers to the young apprentice.

meanings.definition: A grant or conveyance of property by feoffment.
meanings.sent1: The feoff of the manor was a generous gift.
meanings.sent2: She inherited the feoff of the ancient castle.
meanings.sent3: The feoff of the farm caused quite a stir in the village.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a feoff of warmth in the cold room.
meanings.sent5: The feoff of knowledge from the wise elder was invaluable.
